byline.original: By MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON

lead_paragraph: Regulators subpoenaed four firms involved in seller-financed deals for marketing inexpensive homes to lower-income people who can’t get a mortgage.

headline.print_headline: Lenders Subpoenaed Over Seller-Financed Mortgage Alternatives
headline.main: New York Lenders Subpoenaed Over Seller-Financed Mortgage Alternatives

snippet: Regulators subpoenaed four firms involved in seller-financed deals for marketing inexpensive homes to lower-income people who can’t get a mortgage.
abstract: New York State Dept of Financial Services subpoenas four investment firms over seller-financed deals for inexpensive homes to lower-income people who cannot get mortgages; they are Battery Point Financial, New York Mortgage Trust, Apollo Residential Mortgage and unit of Apollo Global Management.
